What a fantastic idea! Adding cumin and coriander to the marinade will give your gochujang chicken wings a fascinating Indian-Korean fusion flavor profile. The earthy, warm flavors of cumin and coriander will complement the sweet, spicy, and smoky notes of the gochujang beautifully.

Cumin and coriander are commonly used in Indian cuisine to add depth and warmth to dishes, and they pair well with the bold flavors of gochujang. The cumin will add a slightly bitter, earthy flavor, while the coriander will contribute a sweet, citrusy note. These spices will also help to balance the heat from the gochujang, making the dish more approachable for those who prefer milder flavors.

When using cumin and coriander, keep the following in mind:

* Start with a small amount, such as 1/4 teaspoon of each, and adjust to taste. You can always add more, but it's harder to remove excess spice from the marinade.
* Use ground cumin and coriander for this recipe, as they'll dissolve more easily into the marinade.
* If you want to add more Indian flair, you could also consider adding a small amount of garam masala, cayenne pepper, or turmeric to the marinade.

Here's an updated marinade recipe incorporating cumin, coriander, and Greek yogurt:

**Gochujang Chicken Wings Marinade (with Indian Spices and Greek Yogurt):**

* 2 tablespoons gochujang
* 2-3 tablespoons Greek yogurt
* 1 tablespoon brown sugar
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 tablespoon grated ginger
* 1 teaspoon sesame oil
* 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
* 1/4 teaspoon ground coriander
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1 tablespoon lime juice (optional)

Mix all the ingredients together, adjusting the amount of yogurt, cumin, and coriander to your taste. Marinate the chicken wings for at least 2 hours or overnight, then bake or grill until cooked through.

I'm excited to hear how your Indian-Korean fusion gochujang chicken wings turn out! Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance.
